cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Tropical Depression (below SSHS hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SE of Freeport Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift northwest across the central and north-western Bahamas on Friday, reach the east-central Florida coast Saturday, cross the peninsula and emerge over northeast Gulf waters Sunday before curving north-northeast toward Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or just offshore the east-central to northeast Florida coast (near the Space Coast – Daytona Beach to Jacksonville corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect from Jupiter Inlet northward to the Volusia–Brevard County line (east-central Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for the north-western Bahamas (excluding Andros Island)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, north-west Bahamas, southeast Georgia and eventually the Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Low-to-moderate chance (≈20–25%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty squalls possible Saturday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (likely less than 2 ft) possible along immediate beaches and St. Johns River entrance during onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher pockets possible Saturday–Sunday, producing brief fresh-water ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents and lowered visibility for vessel traffic beginning late Saturday.
